means: 2。[废语]难驾驭的人（尤指不肯接受求爱的女人）

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 16th cent. (used in falconry): from French hagard; perhaps related to hedge; later influenced by hag

entry.tran: （尤指因病或睡眠不足）憔悴的，形容枯槁的，困倦的
entry.def: Someone who looks haggard has a tired expression and shadows under their eyes, especially because they are ill or have not had enough sleep.

example.ex: He was pale and a bit haggard...
Nick glanced around at the haggard faces watching him.
example.tran: 尼克环视着盯着自己的那一张张憔悴的面孔。

means.word_mean: 1. showing the wearing effects of overwork or care or suffering;

sentences.sentence: "looking careworn as she bent over her mending"
"her face was drawn and haggard from sleeplessness"
"shocked to see the worn look of his handsome young face"- Charles Dickens

means.word_mean: 2. very thin especially from disease or hunger or cold;

sentences.sentence: "a nightmare population of gaunt men and skeletal boys"
"kept life in his wasted frame only by grim concentration"
